result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

**AMENDED ON 8-15-22:  NO VIOLENT PHONE CONTACT WITH MOTHER OF CHILDREN.  DO NOT DISCUSS THE CASE.**

9:40 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leroy Walker III in court.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Leroy Walker III. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Defense files a bond motion.  Defense makes further argument.  Defense is asking for telephonic communication with the mother of his children. Defense is also asking for bond money to be returned.  State objects to the contact with the mother of the children.  State does not object to the money being returned.  Defense responds.  BTC: Bond modified to $2000 cash, no violent phone contact, do not discuss the case.

Atty Preston has spoken to D.W.s atty yesterday.  The State objects to any bond modification.  BTC: Bond modification denied. 9:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leroy Walker III in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin J. Preston in court for Leroy Walker III. Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  Defense asks for another status.  The mother of the children in in court.  Defense files a bond motion.  The mother has provided a notarized statement to defense.  The defendant understands there would be no contact with the children, defense is asking to have the no contact lifted with the mother, D.W.  State takes no position on the monetary bond, the State asks that the no contact remain with all parties.  The State has no information on the open cases with both parents with CPS in St. Cloud, Minnesota.  The court has concerns.  BTC: Bond modification denied.  The court needs more information regarding the open case in St. Cloud, Minnesota.
